title: Haringey Borough players walk off pitch after reporting racist abuse from Yeovil Town fans
text:
Haringey Borough's FA Cup qualifier against Yeovil was abandoned on Saturday after their players walked off the pitch following allegations of racial abuse from some supporters.

The home players walked off 64 minutes in, shortly after Rhys Murphy had scored a penalty for Yeovil past Haringey goalkeeper Douglas Pajetat.

Pajetat claimed he was subject to racial abuse from some of the Yeovil away fans while waiting for the penalty to be taken. The Cameroonian also said he was spat at and had bottles thrown at him.

Both sets of players later returned to the pitch after the abandonment in a "show of solidarity".

Haringey supporter Ben James attended the game and told the Press Association: "We were stood toward the other end so can't comment on what we heard. But it all began when the referee gave Yeovil a penalty. It seemed like their fans were trying to wind up the Haringey goalie by shaking the net and the like.
description: Haringey Borough's FA Cup qualifier against Yeovil was abandoned on Saturday after their players walked off the pitch following allegations of racial abuse from some supporters.
